p: Trace elements play a very important role in the formation of the active chemical constituents present in medicinal plants. The quantitative estimation of various trace element concentrations is important for determining the effectiveness of the plants in treating various diseases, and understanding their pharmacological action. Raw materials from medicinal plants are used in the preparation of various modern drugs and they have even been used as the principal source of raw materials for conventional drugs in the developing countries where these plants are easily found in local markets. They are available in the mixture of medicinal plant extracts and in capsule form; therefore, they are easy to use and the industry promises more quick effects. There is great interest in tracing the essential elements and their composition in medicinal science; it is believed that the great majority of these elements are key components of an essential enzyme system or vital bio-chemical function.
